Package simulation.montecarlo

Class Lattice.MagneticMomentsSolveIter

java.lang.Object
simulation.montecarlo.Lattice.MagneticMomentsSolveIter
Enclosing class:
Lattice
private class Lattice.MagneticMomentsSolveIter extends Object
Class of methods used to find a self-consistent solution for the magnetic moments All methods here should be considered as ruining the singleSpin[] lattice in case an exception is thrown, hence a copy should be made before calling them.

    • updateAllMagneticMoments

      public void updateAllMagneticMoments​(int[] sweepOrder, int maxIter, double tol, double alpha, int flipSpin, boolean print, double frac, boolean retryWithLowerAlpha, boolean smoothHomotopy)
      Basic iterative solver, performs a (nonlinear) Gauss-Seidel scheme, i.e., 1. update a spin's magnetic moment based on the applied local field 2. update the fields at all other sites based on the previous change 3. go to the next spin 4. loop through all spins in this way 5. repeat until convergence is achieved *** Important *** This method does not verify convergence in the same way as other methods. It stops when successive changes become small, which might indicate convergece, but convergence must be checked in the traditional way after it is called.
      Parameters:
      sweepOrder - the order in which we loop through the spins
      maxIter - maximum number of iterations over the entire system
      tol - tolerance for convergence
      alpha - relaxation parameter for the update in #1 (for values less than 1, we update the magnetic moment to a weighted average of the previous magnetic moment and the new magnetic moment
      flipSpin - the spin that is being flipped (used in the various homotopic solvers: homotopicSolve(int[], int, double, int, double), homotopicSolve2(int[], int, double, int, double), homotopicSolve3(int[], int, double, int, double) )
      print - whether to print the progress. useful for debugging
      frac - the fraction by which to mix the previous spin with the new spin (used in the various homotopic methods)
      retryWithLowerAlpha - whether to try again with a lower (half) value of alpha and higher (double) number of maxIter in case convergence is not achieved after the given number of iterations
      smoothHomotopy - whether to change the magnetic moment's target function in a manner that does not make it ill-defined at any stage

    • removeSpecificSpinConstibution

      public void removeSpecificSpinConstibution​(int spinToRemove, double magneticMomentToRemove)
      Removes the contribution of a specific spin to the fields at all other sites
      Parameters:
      spinToRemove - the index of the spin whose contribution is to be removed
      magneticMomentToRemove - the magnetic moment to remove from the other spins (that of spinToRemove)

    • addMixedSpinField

      public void addMixedSpinField​(int flipSpin, double magneticMoment)
      Add to the field at all sites a contribution of some spin with a given magnetic moment
      Parameters:
      flipSpin - the spin whose contribution is to be added to all other sites
      magneticMoment - the assumed magnetic moment of flipSpin. usually a some mixture of the previous and new spin orientation

    • homotopicSolve

      public void homotopicSolve​(int[] bfsOrder, int maxIter, double tol, int flipSpin, double alpha) throws ConvergenceException
      Solves the self-consistent calculation by gradually flipping the given spin
      Parameters:
      bfsOrder - the order in which we loop through the spins
      maxIter - maximum number of iterations over the entire system
      tol - tolerance for convergence
      flipSpin - the spin that is being flipped
      alpha - relaxation parameter for the update in #1 (for values less than 1, we update the magnetic moment to a weighted average of the previous magnetic moment and the new magnetic moment
      Throws:
      ConvergenceException

    • homotopicSolve2

      public void homotopicSolve2​(int[] bfsOrder, int maxIter, double tol, int flipSpin, double alpha) throws ConvergenceException
      Solves the self-consistent calculation by gradually flipping the given spin in a more sophisticated way than homotopicSolve(int[], int, double, int, double)
      Parameters:
      bfsOrder - the order in which we loop through the spins
      maxIter - maximum number of iterations over the entire system
      tol - tolerance for convergence
      flipSpin - the spin that is being flipped
      alpha - relaxation parameter for the update in #1 (for values less than 1, we update the magnetic moment to a weighted average of the previous magnetic moment and the new magnetic moment
      Throws:
      ConvergenceException

    • homotopicSolve3

      public void homotopicSolve3​(int[] bfsOrder, int maxIter, double tol, int flipSpin, double alpha) throws ConvergenceException
      Solves the self-consistent calculation by gradually flipping the given spin in a manner that does not make the target function for the magnetic moment ill-defined at any step.
      Parameters:
      bfsOrder - the order in which we loop through the spins
      maxIter - maximum number of iterations over the entire system
      tol - tolerance for convergence
      flipSpin - the spin that is being flipped
      alpha - relaxation parameter for the update in #1 (for values less than 1, we update the magnetic moment to a weighted average of the previous magnetic moment and the new magnetic moment
      Throws:
      ConvergenceException
      See Also:
      FieldTable.getValue(double, double, double, double, int[][], double, boolean)
